result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Robert J Nagle in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Robert J Nagle.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard;  statement made. ongoing negotiations- 4th status. Trial set. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert J Nagle in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Robert J Nagle.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court and makes statement. Parties are still negotiating. Last status conference. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Nagle in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Robert J Nagle. Victim also resent in court and makes statement. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Nagle in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Robert J Nagle. Resolution possible. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

BOND TO COVER 22CM282 & 22CM283

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.H., ABLE TO GO TO RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Nagle in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Robert J Nagle. Motion to revise bond by Attorney Harvey. Argument, granted. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Defendant started counseling, victim filed letter on friday after 4 pm to lift no contact, would like no violent contact. Minutes filed.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.H. dob 1-22-1995 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2272, 22-2273

Defendant Robert J Nagle in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
